result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melani Mayorga-Ayala

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melani Mayorga-Ayala in court.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Melani Mayorga-Ayala.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:34 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for adjourned initial appearance as to all files - 22CM427, 22CM428, 22CM474. Record by Atty. Daane who enters not guilty pleas on behalf of the defendant as to all files and reserves rights. Court sets all matters for status about 90 days out.
Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CM474, 22CM427 & 22CM428

MUST PROVIDE AN ADDRESS BEFORE RELEASE. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH J.M.S dob 5-18-1959 or N.A. dob 6-5-1969. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.A.H. 1-11-2007.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Memo in Support of Bond Modification MMA

Defendant Melani Mayorga-Ayala not in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan- P. for Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Melani Mayorga-Ayala.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:17 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance on both files - 22cm427 & 22CM428. Record by Atty. Ryan P. that he is covering for Atty. Daane who is requesting matters be adjourned until he is back. Defendant is currently back in the hospital. Court grants request and sets both matters out. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Called at 1:28 PM. Defendant Melani Mayorga-Ayala in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane for defendant. Record by court who addresses Attorney Daane as to release and now new crimes. Response by Attorney Daane. Discussion as to bond. Total bond set, $5000 and same prior conditions, plus new no contact. Minutes flied.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22GF875, 22CM427 & 22CM428

MUST PROVIDE AN ADDRESS BEFORE RELEASE. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.M.S. dob 5-18-1959 or N.A. dob 6-5-1969 or THEIR RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH C.A.H. 1-11-2007.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
22-3882,3883

*see new bond set 8/22/2022*
BOND TO COVER 22CM428 & 22CM427

MUST PROVIDE AN ADDRESS BEFORE RELEASE. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.M.S. dob 5-18-1959 or N.A. dob 6-5-1969 or THEIR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at 3:07PM. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melani Mayorga-Ayala in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Melani Mayorga-Ayala. Matter before court for bond motion. Record by Attorney Daane as to motion. Argument by State as to concern as to where defendant is to go due to other matters. Response by Attorney Daane. Court grants motion but will need an address before she can be released. Amended to $10,000 RoR. Same conditions. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
